page.title: 12FARMING..APPLE GROWING.
page.content: At Bockingfold farm they have sixty acres of Bramley apples.In the Autumn the apples are picked by hand,a long and tedious job.In Kent 98% of orchards are picked by hand as orchards have to be planted in a special way to be picked by machine and also the fruit can be damaged by picking with machines. Frost is a great enemy for the fruit farmer as frost damages the fruit the most.At Bockingfold farm water pumped from the river is used for the irrigation of the apples.In the spring,water is sprayed onto the fruit where it freezes and acts as an insulator against frost.Some farms have constructed reservoirs for this purpose. When the apples are picked theyget 5 cwt.per acre.The oldest orchard at Bockingfold farm was planted in 11950 and is still going strong.
